title: SkiaSharp.Forms is missing wheel events for mouse platforms
body:
First lets say thank you very much for your work. It is great and I enjoy it.

I'm missing for the SkiaSharp implementation for Xamarin.Forms a SKTouchAction.WheelUp and SKTouchAction.WheelDown for the mouse. The click with the wheel is correct handled as MouseButton.Middle. It would be perfect to have this for platforms, that use a mouse (UWP and Mac).

> VS bug [#727960](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/727960)

comments.author: charlenni
comments.body: Are there any news about this?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: We will be looking into this in the future, depending on demand. I would actually rather see Xamarin.Forms get these mouse, touch and pen interaction features in the framework. Right now, if you use SkiaSharp touch events, they override the Xamarin.Forms gestures.

comments.author: APopatanasov
comments.body:
Hi @mattleibow ,

When 1.68.1 is expected to be released? That particular feature is really nice addition to the "Touch" API and I will be glad to use it. 😄 

P.S. @charlenni Nice job! 🥇

comments.author: rbrian
comments.body:
Need 1.68.1 :) Wanting to add wheel support for zooming on my canvasview descendant. Great work, @charlenni ! 

I agree with earlier comments that the touch handling needs to be upstream in all of Forms. Can't think of a specific use case in my current projects, but would seem to be a good thing.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: This was added in v1.68.1 over a few PRs.
